article.title: Major_League_Baseball_Most_Valuable_Player_Award

template.arg: Major League Baseball Most Valuable Player Award (MVP)

A black circle with an octagonal silver plaque in the middle. The edge of the plaque reads "KENESAW MOUNTAIN LANDIS MEMORIAL BASEBALL AWARD". In the middle of the octagon is a baseball diamond which contains, from the top, Judge Landis' face in gold, "Most Valuable Player", the winner's league, his name in a gold rectangle, and his team.
Major League Baseball's Regular Season MVP

article.paragraph: TheMajor League Baseball Most Valuable Player Award(MVP) is an annualMajor League Baseball(MLB) award, given to one outstanding player in theAmerican Leagueand one in theNational League. Since 1931, it has been awarded by theBaseball Writers' Association of America(BBWAA). The winners receive theKenesaw Mountain LandisMemorial Baseball Award, which became the official name of the award in 1944,cite webLandis, KenesawNational Baseball Hall of Fame and Museumhttp://baseballhall.org/hof/landis-kenesaw2011-11-22in honor of the firstCommissioner of Baseball (MLB)MLB commissioner, who served from 1920 until his death on November 25, 1944.cite bookGilletteGaryPalmer, PeteThe ESPN Baseball EncyclopediaSterling Publishing CoNew York City, New York2007Fourth1763978-1-4027-4771-7

MVP voting takes place before theMajor League Baseball postseasonpostseason, but the results are not announced until after theWorld Series. The BBWAA began by polling three writers in each league city in 1938, reducing that number to two per league city in 1961.Gillette & Palmer, pp. 17641765The BBWAA does not offer a clear-cut definition of what "most valuable" means, instead leaving the judgment to the individual voters.cite newsKepnerTylerWhere Do You Find Value? Discussing the M.V.P. CriteriaSeptember 4, 2011[[The New York Times]]SP3http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/04/sports/baseball/blue-jays-bautista-and-yankees-granderson-discuss-mvp-criteria.html?scpSeptember 6, 2011

First basemen, with 34 winners, have won the most MVPs amonginfielders, followed bysecond basemen (16),third basemen (15), andshortstops (15). Of the 24 pitcherswho have won the award, 15 areright-handedwhile 9 areleft-handed.Walter Johnson,Carl Hubbell, andHal Newhouserare the only pitchers who have won multiple times, Newhouser winning consecutively in 1944 and 1945.cite journalDecember 2000Major League Baseball's Most Valuable Player Award WinnersBaseball DigestCentury Publishing Co.Evanston, Illinois591286â€“890005-609Xhttp://books.google.com/books?idDecember 29, 2009http://www.baseball-reference.com/players/j/johnswa01.shtml

Hank Greenberg,Stan Musial,Alex Rodriguez, andRobin Younthave won at different positions,while Rodriguez is the only player who has won the award with two different teams at two different positions.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/players/r/rodrial01.shtmlAlex Rodriguez Statistics[[Baseball-Reference]]Sports Reference LLCDecember 3, 2009Barry Bondshas won the most often (seven times) and the most consecutively (200104).cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/players/b/bondsba01.shtmlBarry Bonds Statistics[[Baseball-Reference]]Sports Reference LLCDecember 3, 2009Jimmie Foxxwas the first player to win multiple times;cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/players/f/foxxji01.shtmlJimmie Foxx Statistics[[Baseball-Reference]]Sports Reference LLCDecember 3, 20099 players have won three times, and 19 have won twice.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/mvp_cya.shtmlMost Valuable Player MVP Awards & Cy Young Awards Winners[[Baseball-Reference]]Sports Reference LLCDecember 3, 2009Frank Robinsonis the only player to win the award in both the American and National Leagues.

The award's only tie occurred in theNational Leaguein 1979, whenKeith HernandezandWillie Stargellreceived an equal number of points.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1979.shtmlBaseball Awards Voting for 1979[[Baseball-Reference]]Sports Reference LLCDecember 28, 2009There have been 17 unanimous winners, who received all the first-place votes.TheNew York Yankeeshave the most winning players with 22, followed by theSt. Louis Cardinalswith 17 winners. The award has never been presented to a member of the following five teams:Arizona Diamondbacks,Miami Marlins,New York Mets,Tampa Bay Rays, andWashington Nationals. The most recent recipients areMike Troutin theAmerican LeagueandClayton Kershawin theNational League.

In recent decades, pitchers have rarely won the award. WhenJustin Verlanderwon the AL award in 2011, he became the first pitcher in either league to be named the MVP sinceDennis Eckersleyin 1992. Verlander also became the firststarting pitcherto win this award since Roger Clemens had accomplished the feat in 1986.cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/22/sports/baseball/justin-verlander-is-first-pitcher-named-mvp-since-1992.html?srcThe New York TimesTylerKepnerVerlander Is First Pitcher Named M.V.P. Since 1992November 21, 2011The National League went even longer without an MVP award to a pitcherafterBob Gibsonwon in 1968, no pitcher in that league was named MVP until Kershaw in 2014.cite webhttp://bbwaa.com/14-nl-mvp/Clayton Kershaw, DodgersBaseball Writers Association of AmericaJanuary 19, 2015
article.heading: Chalmers Award (19111914)
article.paragraph: File:Ty-Cobb-1913-NPC-detail-1.jpegthumbrightTy Cobbwon the first American League Chalmers Award in 1911 and was at the center of the controversy over the previous season's award.alt=Ty Cobb looking just to the left of the camera.Before the1910 Major League Baseball season1910 season, Hugh Chalmers ofChalmers Automobileannounced he would present a Chalmers Model 30 automobile to the player with the highestbatting averagein Major League Baseball at the end of the season. The1910 Chalmers Award1910 race for best average in the American Leaguewas between theDetroit Tigers' widely dislikedcite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idMirrors of SportDoyleHaveyJuly 4, 1941[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]18January 19, 2010Dead linkOctober 2010H3llBotcite webhttp://espn.go.com/sportscentury/features/00014142.htmlHe was a pain ... but a great painSchwartzLarry[[ESPN.com]]January 19, 2010Ty CobbandNap Lajoieof theCleveland Indians. On the last day of the season, Lajoie overtook Cobb's batting average with sevenBunt (baseball)bunthits against theBaltimore OriolesSt. Louis Browns. American League PresidentBan Johnsonsaid a recalculation showed that Cobb had won the race anyway, and Chalmers ended up awarding cars to both players.

The1911 Major League Baseball seasonfollowing season, Chalmers created the Chalmers Award. A committee of baseball writers were to convene after the season to determine the "most important and useful player to the club and to the league". Since the award was not as effective at advertising as Chalmers had hoped, it was discontinued after 1914.
article.heading: League Awards (19221929)
article.paragraph: File:Babe Ruth2.jpgthumbrightBabe Ruthwas ineligible for the award in his famous 1927 season by the rules of the American League award because he had previously won in 1923.alt=A man in full baseball attire wears a pinstriped jersey and a hat with overlapping white "N" and "Y". Looking to the left of the camera, he is holding a baseball upward.In 1922 the American League created a new award to honor "the baseball player who is of the greatest all-around service to his club".cite webhttp://www.mlb.com/players/rodriguez_alex/article.jsp?storyOne of a kind: Another MVP for A-RodNewmanMarkNovember 14, 2009[[MLB.com]]Major League BaseballDecember 5, 2009Winners, voted on by a committee of eight baseball writers chaired byJames Crusinberry,cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idRogers Hornsby Voted Most Valuable Player in National LeagueGouldAlanDecember 8, 1929[[Reading Eagle]]January 6, 2010received a bronze medal and a cash prize.cite newsPlayer Award Goes to Hornsby againDecember 8, 1929[[The New York Times]]S2Voters were required to select one player from each team andplayer-coachesand prior award winners were ineligible. These flaws resulted in the awards being dropped after 1928. The National League award, without these restrictions, lasted from 1924 to 1929.
article.heading: Baseball Writers' Association of America's Most Valuable Player (1931present)
article.paragraph: The BBWAA first awarded the modern MVP after the1931 Major League Baseball season1931 season, adopting the format the National League used to distribute its league award. One writer in each city with a team filled out a ten-place ballot, with ten points for the recipient of a first-place vote, nine for a second-place vote, and so on. In 1938, the BBWAA raised the number of voters to three per city and gave 14 points for a first-place vote. The only significant change since then occurred in 1961, when the number of voters was reduced to two per league city.

link.part: Jimmie Foxxwas the first player to win three MVP awards.
alt=A man is pictured from his belt up looking to the left of the camera. His button-down baseball jersey says "RED SOX" across it and he is wearing a baseball hat with a "B".
Hall of Famer and 2-time MVP,Hank Greenberg
Hall of FamerWillie Mayswon the award in 1954 and 1965 with the same team in different cities.
alt=The face of a dark-skinned man who is smiling widely. The letters "S" and "F" overlap on his hat.
Barry Bonds' seven MVPs are the most for any individual player.

alt=An African-American man looks just right of the camera. His helmet and white jersey both have an orange "S" over "F" logo on them. The man's left arm is crossed over his body and his right is out of the picture. There is a black and orange glove on his left hand.
Alex Rodriguezwon the award with two different teams at two different positions.

alt=A Hispanic man walking while shouting at someone out of the picture. His helmet is emblazoned with a white "N" and "Y" intertwined, and "NEW YORK" is stitched in black letters across his button-down jersey. The player is holding a black baseball bat almost vertically with black, gray, and white gloves.
Albert Pujolswon the award three times, all at first base with theSt. Louis Cardinals.
alt=A right-handed batter is at the plate, looking toward the pitcher's mound. Wearing a red uniform and white pants, there is a crowd behind him with jerseys of various colors.
Miguel Cabrerawas the winner of back-to-back AL Awards from 2012-13.

article.heading: Notes

list.listitem: note labelNumberaaA player is considered inactive if he has announced his retirement or not played for a full season.
note labelNumberbbA unanimous victory indicates that the player received all possible first-place votes.
note labelNumberccHernandez and Stargell both received 216 points in the 1979 voting.

note labelNumberddTorre is a member of the Hall of Fame, but not as a player. He was inducted inbhofy2014as aManager (baseball)manager.cite webhttp://baseballhall.org/hof/torre-joeJoe TorreNational Baseball Hall of Fame and MuseumNovember 13, 2014
